cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 210 miles SE of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west, turning WNW to NW Saturday, expected to skirt the lower Florida Keys then track north-northwest just offshore the west coast of Florida toward the Florida Panhandle
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle (near the Big Bend / Apalachicola area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Southwest Florida coast from Englewood south and east to Ocean Reef
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida Keys west of Ocean Reef to Dry Tortugas and Florida Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, west coast of the Florida peninsula, Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty squalls, sustained winds generally below tropical-storm force (25–30 mph)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side of southeast Florida
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches possible with locally higher amounts up to 8 inches, leading to urban and small-stream flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low but non-zero risk of isolated tornadoes beginning Saturday afternoon
